intro: Jacquinia nipensis, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces clusters of blue to purple flowers in the spring. It is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
